summary: A locals-expression creates an object that describes the local variables in the enclosing scope.
details: All user-visible variables in the enclosing scope will be captured.
This includes user-visible variables in outer scopes, if any.
This excludes temporary variables created by the compiler.
Return an object that describes the local variables in the enclosing scope.
example-1: module Main in examples;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    val city = %22London%22;%0A    val year = 2014;%0A    val primes = [2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17];%0A%0A    val map = (locals);%0A%0A    foreach (x : Local in map.locals())%0A    {%0A        F::println(x);%0A    }%0A}
args : String[] = [Ljava.lang.String;@6807299a%0Acity : String = London%0Aprimes : List = [2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17]%0Ayear : int = 2014
